comments.author: u413543@disabled.tld
comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_6_7) AppleWebKit/534.29 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/12.0.733.0 Safari/534.29
Build Identifier: 3.1.9

When I paste text from a fillable PDF form —specifically the text answers typed into the forma sections, not the non-fillable PDF text — into an e-mail and send it, everything typed after the pasted PDF text is deleted, including the signature.   This ONLY happens with PDF files open in Adobe Reader (using version 8.2.6) and ONLY text typed into the fillable form sections of a fillable PDF; does not happen with text from Excel, or even from the same PDF form opened in Preview.  Pasting the text with or without formatting makes no difference.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  Open PDF in Adobe Reader, copy text typed into one of the fillable form areas
2.  Create new e-mail message in Thunderbird, paste PDF text into e-mail
3.  Send e-mail
Actual Results:  
The e-mail is sent by all text typed immediately after the pasted PDF text is deleted, including the signature

Expected Results:  
Sent all the text typed into the e-mail without deleting/truncating anything

comments.text: I see several typos, sorry.  "Actual Results" should say that the "e-mail is sent BUT all text typed..."

comments.text:

Any errors in Tools -> Error console when this happens ?

Does this happens if Thunderbird is started in -safe-mode (http://support.mozillamessaging.com/en-US/kb/Safe+Mode) ?
